enable.title: Enable Driver
enable.description: Enable or disable the driver on a SteamVR level. This option disables/enables the driver in SteamVR - equivalent to enabling/disabling within SteamVR settings > startup shutdown > manage addons.

hardware_calibration_button_enabled.description:
Whether the hardware calibration button should also calibrate the pose.
The pose can also be calibrated in the functions section in this UI.

approximate_thumb.title: Approximate Thumb Position
approximate_thumb.description: On games that don't support smooth thumb positions, approximate the position of the thumb with capacitive touch emulation.

left_port.title: Left Serial Port
left_port.description:
Left serial port for the device.
Serial port values should start with a \\.\COM.

right_port.title: Right Serial Port
right_port.description:
Right serial port for the device.
Serial port values should start with a \\.\COM.

left_serial_number.description:
Serial number for the left controller.
This can typically be left as default.

right_serial_number.description:
Serial number for the right controller.
This can typically be left as default.

max_analog_value.title: Maximum Analog Value
max_analog_value.description:
Maximum analog value.
For an ESP32, the maximum value should be 4095.
For an Arduino Nano, the maximum value should be 1023.

controller_override_left.title: Left Controller Override Id
controller_override_left.description:
If the driver isn't picking up your default controllers correctly,
you can override it by entering the steamvr id of the controller here.

controller_override_right.title: Right Controller Override Id
controller_override_right.description:
If the driver isn't picking up your default controllers correctly,
you can override it by entering the steamvr id of the controller here.

controller_override.title: Enable Controller Override
controller_override.description:
If the driver isn't picking up your default controllers correctly,
enable this and set the ids of your default controllers.

pose_time_offset.title: Predicted Pose Time Offset
pose_time_offset.description:
The amount of time in the future to predict where the controller is.
If your glove is lagging behind your controller, try changing this value.

feedback_enabled.title: Feedback Enabled
feedback_enabled.description: Whether the driver should send back information (like force feedback data) to the glove. You should make sure that the firmware is not expecting data to be sent from the driver if you disable this option.

index_curl_as_trigger.title: Use Index Curl as Trigger
index_curl_as_trigger.description: Force the emulated controller's trigger value to follow your index finger's curl amount. (Legacy behavior)
